title: Samsung Galaxy S8 and S8 Plus tipped to offer 5.8-inch and 6.2-inch QHD displays
text:
Samsung Galaxy S8 and S8 Plus tipped to offer 5.8-inch and 6.2-inch... Samsung Galaxy S8 and S8 Plus tipped to offer 5.8-inch and 6.2-inch QHD displays By February 13, 2017 “The Galaxy S8 and S8+ will get edge-to-edge Super AMOLED displays” 
Samsung’s upcoming flagships, the Galaxy S8 and Galaxy S8 Plus, have been the subject of a number of leaks in the past couple of months. We have already seen a number of renders and a 360-degree video of the phones. Now the popular gadget tipster Evan Blass aka @evleaks has revealed details regarding their displays. In addition, an alleged image of the purple Galaxy S8 Plus has also hit the interwebs. I’ve been seeing this misreported quite a bit, so, just to clarify:GS8 – 5.8″ QHD — Evan Blass (@evleaks) February 12, 2017 
According to Blass, the Samsung Galaxy S8 will flaunt a 5.8-inch QHD (2K) display, while the Galaxy S8 Plus will boast a bigger 6.2-inch Quad HD screen. Both of the phones will get Super AMOLED screen panels. Blass has also posted the branding of the Samsung Galaxy S8+. As for the leaked image, the render of the purple S8 Plus reveals the phone with an edge-to-edge screen. 
According to earlier reports , the Samsung Galaxy S8 and Galaxy S8 Plus will feature 3,000mAh and 3,500mAh batteries respectively. The devices will be powered by a Snapdragon 835 SoC, mated to 6GB of RAM. They are also expected to come equipped with Iris scanners apart from the usual fingerprint sensors. Samsung is expected to launch them at an event on March 29th. The brand is also expected to release a teaser for the device(s) later this month at MWC.
